A ring of mass M, radius R, and rotational inertia MR2 is initially sliding on a frictionless surface at constant velocity v0 to the right, as shown above. At time t = 0 it encounters a surface with coefficient of friction ¬µ and begins sliding and rotating. After traveling a distance L, the ring begins rolling without sliding. Express all answers to the following in terms of M, R, v0, ¬µ, and fundamental constants, as appropriate.

Starting from Newton‚Äôs second law in either translational or rotational form, as appropriate, derive a differential equation that can be used to solve for the magnitude of the following as the ring is sliding and rotating.
